results.title: Radiation@Inagi Tokyo(放射線@東京都稲城市)
results.description:
設置場所　東京都稲城市百村
Arduino(Uno + Ether Shield) + SparkFun SEN-09848(LND-712)
木造アパート2F窓際設置　窓越しの測定
更新間隔　5分
変換係数
　120[CPM] = 1[uSv/h]
　Sv[uSv/h] = CPM×0.00833[uSv/h]
ガイガー管駆動電圧を1300V->500V(定格)に下げる改造済み。
　参考サイト　http://gataro-avr-ken.cocolog-nifty.com/blog/2011/08/sparkfun-1786.html
観測システム構築は下記サイトの方法に従う。
　http://www.yapan.org/main/2011/03/measure_radiation_dose.html

メンテナンスなどで、予告なく停止する場合がありますのでご注意下さい。
この観測システムは、校正は行っていないので正確な値である保証は出来ません。あくまで変化を見る目安として下さい。
●自然放射線量
東京での自然放射線量は、約0.91mSv/yearのようです。毎時だと約0.10uSv/hになります。
この値は、食物摂取量も含む値ですから直接の比較は出来ません。
出典　http://www.atomin.go.jp/reference/radiation/familiarity/index03.html#familiarity07
食物摂取　0.35mSv/year
ラドン　1.3mSv/year　世界平均
この観測値と比較するには、ラドンを加算して食物摂取を引くのが妥当と思われます。
0.91 + 1.3 - 0.35 = 1.86mSv/year = 0.21uSv/hour
ですね。あくまで目安ですが。

results.title: Samukawa Geiger (Now on test in other place)
results.description:
Samukawa-cho geiger counter monitoring post by Wakamatsu-Tsusho Mark2. 
神奈川県高座郡寒川町周辺の空間放射線量を試験的に発信している物であり、この情報に付いて何ら責任を負う者ではありません。ご理解の上でご参照ください。 
数値はμSv/h,nSv/h,CPMともに１時間移動推移です。安価な装置でもなるべく正確な値を得るために、長い時間の平均をとっています。 
発信に当たっては「こばさん」の改造ファームをお借りしています→http://h.wakwak-koba.jp/ 
同時にTwitterの@fujisawa_geigerでも1時間に3回程度ツイートしています。
管理者からの情報伝達のために@fuzkixとともにフォローしていただけると幸甚です。
results.creator: https://xively.com/users/ryofuzuki

results.title: 杉並区上高井戸　環境放射線測定実験(Suginami Tokyo, JAPAN)
results.description:
自作(キット Mark1)の放射線量測定装置を用いて、環境放射線量の測定実験を開始しました。自作キット(Mark1/Mark2)の詳細については、http://blog.goo.ne.jp/markx_lab を参照してください。
GM管(SBM-20)をアルミパイプで覆い、ガンマ線のみを測定できるようにしてあります。
設置場所はマンション3階の室内です。

数値は1時間の移動平均値(2011/09/07から、それ以前は10分平均)、cpmから被曝量に変換された単位が nSv/h となっているので注意してください。

なお、較正は低線量下で市販の環境放射線モニタ(HORIBA PA-1000 Radi)と数値を合わせた程度で正確な値を保証するものではありません。

results.title: 【木場公園周辺】 環境放射線モニタリングポスト試験運用中
results.description:
【本フィードのご紹介】
　江東区の木場公園周辺に設置した私用の環境放射線モニタリングポストです。屋内のγ線放射線量を計測しています。 

放射線量の変化を見やすくするため、表記の単位はuSv/h（マイクロシーベルト毎時）ではなくnSv/h（ナノシーベルト毎時）です。nSv/hを1／1000にしますと、uSv/hへの換算値となります。例えば、70nSv/h ÷ 1000 = 0.07uSv/hです。

【本フィードのご利用にあたって】
　本フィードのデータは、公的な較正に基づいておらず、測定データの正確性は保証されません。さらに、故障によって間違った数値を表示することもございます。よって、自己責任の範囲で、あくまで参考用としてご覧ください。
※本情報に基づいて発生した、いかなる損失、損害の求償の責は負いかねますので、ご了承ください

results.title: Geigerbot-Umeda (CPM, uSv/hr)
results.description:
CPM/ microSv per hr feed from a IPhone Geigerbot connected to a 1968 Frieseke & Höpfner FH40T geiger counter.

1. Technical stuff
As conversion factor the F&H spec 320 CPM at 0.5mR/hr is used (valid for γ -only!). This is equivalent to 5uSv/hr.  For Geigerbot this means the conversion factor is 640/60 equals 10 2/3 is approx. 10.66666666. F&H background radiation detection level or nulleffect is specified between 5 and 12 CPM. The energy-compensated GM tube inside the FH40T Geiger counter is a FHZ76V, sensitive to  β and γ radiation over 0.25MeV.The FHZ76V tube actually contains a Valvo 18550 tube, equivalent to Centronics ZP1320, Mullard Mx164 and LND-713. The  ZP1320 tube sensitivity is 9cps/mR/h for Cs-137 (540cpm/mR/h).  
Sources:
http://radgoes.blogspot.com/  (with thanks to "Rad Goes")
http://www.centronic.co.uk/beta%20gamma%20detectors.htm
http://www.akh.se/tubes/htm/18550.htm
http://www.radiomuseum.org/r/frieseke_strahlungsmessgeraet_fh_4.html
http://geigerbot.com  (with thanks to Nick Dolezal)

2. Disclaimer: 
The equipment is not calibrated however the measured values until now reveal normal background radiation levels according original specification by F&H. Rise in levels could indicate extra radiation from unnatural sources such as Fukushima Dai-ichi. Therefor use these data only as indication for changes and ignore the absolute values. Errors in measurement could occur as experienced already with this old equipment. Such occasion will be reported if possible.

3. NOTICES: 
Geigerbot-Umeda is on-line as of 29 June 2011 9.45pm JST.
All data before 29 June 2011 9.45pm JST are simulated non-real data produced by the IPhone microphone.

30 June 2011: 
Interruption between 7.45am JST and 9.00am JST, with a few unnatural peaks from disconnecting before interruption. Has moved temporarily to Uchisaiwai-cho, test on office location.
11.00am JST : Quite some peaks occur now due to the imperfect acoustic coupling with the iphone microphone. When the interface cable is ready this noise will be eliminated and we can expect avg CPM of about 7-8 again in normal situation.
12.00pm JST minimum 1 hour off-line. Peak at shutdown of Geigerbot application shud be filtered out.
1.00pm JST online again, peaks during the startup, 1st minute  appear, geigerbot should wait for 60secs or more to start giving CPM values.
5.30pm few hours off-line
9.30pm-10.15pm Back at Umeda location - noise, no real measurements could be taken.
10.15pm - Some measurements taken with external probe hanging in the window facing North. 

1 July 2011:
 6.00am JST  Geigerbot shows it restarted during night. For unknown reasons got frozen on Pachube - no continuous measurements  (failing Geigerbot,3g network and/or power-outage?).
1 July 2011 9.45am KEPT OFFLINE NOW UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE. (PACHUBE SHOWS IT IS LIVE NOW WHEN IT IS NOT!)
1:10pm Pachube shows it is "frozen" allright now.
1:21pm Pachube shows it is "LIVE" again WHEN IT IS NOT!
1:59pm Pachube shows it is "frozen" allright now.
2 July 2011:
11.00pm BACK ONLINE with direct cable connection, no attenuation. threshhold at 21300, no auto adjust. Observed too many extra counts when in auto adjust. With higher dosis rate expect wrong counting. A 2400 Hz rimple on the signal still cud cause extra or loss of counts.
11.25 pm Currently the background radiation really seems to be lower than before. The needle leaves the left corner about 4 times per minute.
3 July 2011:
7 am: SHUTDOWN Geigerbot - reading during night got incorrect due to batteries drain.
              WILL NOT GO ONLINE UNTIL THE OLD FH40T IS REVISED.
21 July 2011:
Geigerbot online for test today using the external F&H probe from about 9.45pm until 10.30pm. Nick Dolezal of Geigerbot.com clearly improved with version 1.3.4e now that the noise on my old counter is not producing any error counts in default setup. This weekend will do some mobile surveying around for testing.
N.B. the proposed conversion factor of 10.66666666 by F&H 1968 gives more realistic readings(lower) then 9cps/mR/h specified as the ZP1320 tube sensitivity.

22 July 2011:
9.50pm-10.20pm outdoor survey around the mansion. downstairs and in the park the background radiation looks double about 0.15 uSv/hr. One spot of the mansion which not accessible,surrounded by steel fences and left untouched with a few plants inside seem to give higher counts (20cpm) through the external F&H probe in use now - probably from the concrete. Have to repeat measurement there to see if it is reproducable.

23 July 2011: ONLINE AGAIN. N.B.: VALID DATA START FROM HERE
8.30pm Running from ipod via wlan connection indoors external F&H probe in front of window facing North. Normal background 0.08 uSv/hr.  Geigercounter is supplied with 5VDC from external power supply with Rohm BP5221 DC-DC convertor (84% conversion efficiency) having few external components.
Ignore some higher levels from tests before today due to wrong setup.

24 July 2011
Get a steady 5CPM / 0.08 uSv/hr on average during 24 hours now w/o fail

31 July 2011
After 1 week of uninterrupted service few hours no values due to ipod battery drained. Ipod is kept on backup supply now.

2 August 2011
Might be observing a small upwards trend now. Installed 0.2uSv and 0.4 uSv/hr email notification triggers on the stream. Above 10CPM events are rare with this equipment but those will trigger.

2 September 2011
Geigerbot stopped registration around 20 August 2011 AM during 2 weeks absense. For unknown reason the application was killed. Today returned back to base and restarted Geigerbot successfully.

22 September 2011
Pachube had trouble today - more than 2 hours no data logging possible - just now before 2.30pm JST cud access again. The Geigerbot itself was not affected - data-logging continues as before.
results.creator: https://xively.com/users/piljapan

results.title: Gumyoji Geiger (Now Testing)
results.description:
Gumyoji-cho Minamiku Yokohama Kanagawa Japan. Geiger counter monitoring post by Wakamatsu-Tsusho Mark2. 
神奈川県横浜市南区周辺の空間放射線量を試験的に発信している物であり、この情報に付いて何ら責任を負う者ではありません。ご理解の上でご参照ください。 
数値はμSv/h,nSv/h,CPMともに１時間移動推移です。安価な装置でもなるべく正確な値を得るために、長い時間の平均をとっています。 
発信に当たっては「こばさん」の改造ファームをお借りしています→http://h.wakwak-koba.jp/
同時にTwitterの@Gumyoji_Geigerでも1時間に3回程度ツイートしています。
管理者からの情報伝達のために@fuzkixとともにフォローしていただけると幸甚です。

results.title: Takizawa, Iwate Enviroment
results.description:
Located in a home environment near an outside intake vent.

Using a Sparkfun SEN-09848 with an Arduino Uno, Ethernet & USB shield, and a mini wireless converter (powered by the usb shield)

(Resource: http://www.yapan.org/main/2011/03/measure_radiation_dose.html)

Sparkfun Geiger has cap off (to count alpha, beta, & gamma) and is exposed to 24/7 open airflow

will later be relocated to a permanent outside location running of battery/solar power
results.creator: https://xively.com/users/lostininaka

results.title: Radiation dose in Kushiro City, Hokkaido, Japan
results.description:
数値は参考程度にして下さい。硬β線、γ線の数値で、自然放射線を含みます。
（LND-712にプラスチックのキャップ装着）
装置全体をケース（タッパー）に入れました。

またLND-712のスペック上、～10カウント程度の余計なカウントが含まれています。平均で5カウントを差し引いた数値が妥当でしょうか。
時々フリーズするので適時リセットしています。

Maximum background shielded 50mm Pb + 3mm　Al (cpm)： 10

This is an Unofficial/Non-Government feed and may go offline occasionally for maintenance.
Updated every 1 minutes.
The sensor is LND-712.
The conversion coefficient from cpm to µSv/h is 0.00833.

Arduino with an Ethernet Shield is used with a LND,inc.'s LND-712 Geiger Muller Tube.
2011/5/15 23:30 sensor upgrade! CI-3BG --> LND-712

They report that the average historical radiation level was 22 nano Greys per hour and was typically between 20 and 40 before the Fukushima incident on March 11, 2011.  

This pachube feed is unofficial and experimental. For the most reliable data please directly view the above official URL.

results.title: Geiger Counter Feeds from Asao Kawasaki
results.description:
Update every 1min, provided by Tetsuya Ryuchi.
The conversion coefficient from CPM to uSv/h is 0.00833.

Geiger Counter: Strawberry-linux geiger counter kit.

Sensor model: LND-712 (LND, Inc.)

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

As the measurement unit is converted from CPM (Count per Minute) to
uSv/h,  I initially used 0.00233 as the conversion coefficient (up to
June 9, 2011).

However, once I have received an advise that  0.00833 is more adequate
conversion coefficient for GM Tube LND-712, I have changed the
conversion coefficient to 0.00833 (after June 9, 2011). The new
conversion coefficient is calculated from the data that LND has been
published. Since I do not have any resource to conduct an empirical
test for the validity of this conversion coefficient and/or the
original data, this conversion coefficient is only reasonable
(scientifically unproven).

Overall, since there have been no spikes and/or significant changes in
CPM that GM Tube measures, I believe that there have not much change
in the level of radiation in the natural environment.
results.creator: https://xively.com/users/ryuchi

results.title: Tokyo Hackerspace Geiger Counter
results.description:
This is one of the Tokyo Hackerspace geiger counters. Its located outdoors in Ikebukuro in Tokyo, Japan. It's a Ludlum Model 2A with Eberline HP-260 probe. The probe has a conversion factor of CPM/360 for uSv/Hr.You can find out more information about the equipment here:
http://bit.ly/gcapPw 

Updated 2011-04-12: Sorry, was doing some testing and messed up the feed. Should be back to normal in a bit.
results.creator: https://xively.com/users/tokyohackerspace
